metadata.title: CVE-2018-16301 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
The command-line argument parser in tcpdump before 4.99.0 has a bufferoverflow in tcpdump.c:read_infile(). To trigger this vulnerability theattacker needs to create a 4GB file on the local filesystem and to specifythe file name as the value of the -F command-line argument of tcpdump.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.99.1-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.99.1-3build1').
